alert.note: Alert for Carter (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 3:34PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Carter, Sullivan and Washington. Portions of southwest Virginia, including the following independent city, City of Bristol. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 434 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Johnson City, Kingsport, Bristol Tn, Bristol Va, Elizabethton, Jonesborough, Oak Grove, Spurgeon, Gray, Colonial Heights, Midway, Central, Pine Crest, Walnut Hill, Mount Carmel, Bluff City, Watauga, Tri-City Airport, Warriors Path State Park and Rocky Mount State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
